medical_history.chief_complaint: Chest pain with associated symptoms of nausea, diaphoresis, and paleness.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced sudden onset of chest pain in the epigastrium radiating to the chest, lasting 10 minutes before improving. Symptoms recurred 30 minutes later. Upon arrival at the facility, the patient denied abdominal pain and reported feeling generally well with no specific complaints.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Multiple Sclerosis - Diagnosed with vision loss and treated with prednisone, currently in remission. 2. History of appendectomy. 3. History of tonsillectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Father had lung cancer; mother had lung cancer.
